WRITING.TITLE: Nutella-filled cinnamon rolls

WRITING.TEXT:
Honestly my experience with yeast is that it's best to experiment with recipes before you make them expecting a perfect result. Yeast is very finicky and if the liquid you add to the recipe is too hot you run the risk of deactivating the yeast.
Rising time is also key. You want to let your yeast doughs proof for exactly how long the recipe states. Let them rest in a well greased bowl (make sure to cover the dough in oil too to prevent it from getting a dry coating) and place in a warm place(I usually preheat my oven and turn it off 5 mins before adding the bowl of dough).
For cinnamon rolls there's the initial rise and then you roll the dough, fill and cut it and then let it ride again and bake! They gain height in the oven as well.
If you want a good recipe just send me a message and I will tell you it. It's been a foolproof recipe for me.

I was chopping onions when the "Christmas shoes" song came on. What unfortunate coincidences have happened to you recently?
WRITING.TEXT:
The dreaded "Christmas Shoes" song came on while I was chopping onions...my eyes were already misty and by the time the song finished, tears were streaming down my face. I had to explain to my family that the tears were from chopping onions and not the dang song!
What unfortunate coincidences have happened to you recently?
No problem! Hope you enjoy them

I feel you...it seems like every year i simultaneously get excited and dread Christmas at the same time. I feel like everyone just becomes so materialistic and greedy and that makes me angry.
Christmas is about giving and family...not sales and shopping. I feel like Christmas is more towards kids than adults. There's no longer that magic of waking up on Christmas morning. Instead, I wake up and dread seeing my family as they all sit around stuffing their faces and pretending to stand each other's presence.
Am I bitter about Christmas? No. But I am bitter about how Christmas is viewed.
So how I deal with it is simply by living it like any other day. It's only one day of the year.
Yeah, sorry... my wording sucked

WRITING.TEXT: Definition of a fuckboy

I was diagnosed at a relatively young age (about 14), but sufferer years before I told anyone or asked for help.
It's not easy to ask for help as somehow we've created a stigma surrounding mental illness and it's still a taboo topic. What you have to do though is make sure you tell someone you're comfortable around. Whether it be a parent, family member or friend, make sure they're able to get you help to diagnose you.
I told my schools guidance counsellor and asked that he call my mom and tell her for me. When she learned, she was upset I didn't tell her but understood and booked me an appointment where I was diagnosed with depression.
There are resources you can go to if you're not comfortable telling family or friends. You can tell your doctor and ask for help. Remember that you don't have to tell everyone but make sure someone knows. Please get help before things become worse.
Wishing you well.

WRITING.TITLE: What are your "I can't believe I was in that relationship" stories?
WRITING.TEXT:
I had a fling with this guy for two months. At first he was nice, sweet and respectable but then he just got really disgusting. I worked with him and when we were alone together he popped random boners and wanted me to "show him a good time". And when I refused to send him nudes he became rude and whiny. He was also racist, sexist and lazy. He expected me to be thin but was significantly overweight....I honestly look back on my relationship with him and cringe the fuck out. Sometimes I questions my decisions haha...
So, women of Reddit, what is your cringe worthy relationship story?

I felt like baking but didn't have any of the essentials so I swung by bulk barn and picked up some cake mix, cookie mix and mini cookies. This is the lazy man's "brookie". Cookie dough layered with mini cookies and chocolate cake batter, cooked for 30 mins.
I enjoyed eating the raw doughs but the final product I found too dry and sweet. It was fun to make but I'll just stick to normal cookies and brownies for now.

Cookie dough base with condensed milk middle. Chopped cookies, caramels and chocolate in the middle too. Then topped off with cookie dough and more sweets.
Last night I made chocolate chip cookies which didn't turn out too great so I decided to make something with them.
I tweaked a recipe from Sally's Baking Addiction. I chopped up the cookies and added them between the layers along with caramels and kit kat bars.

WRITING.TITLE: The Ultimate cookie bar.

WRITING.TEXT:
It's an Italian pastry that's usually filled with ricotta and candied fruit peels. The layers are basic flour and water and then brushed with a lard and butter mixture. It creates a very crunchy shell which mixes with the creamy inside.
If you live near an Italian bakery I'd recommend trying one!

Haha same here! I get convinced that one more drink wouldn't hurt. Learned my lesson after I woke up passed out on the couch covered in vomit
Believe me...I think I swore as much as I did all year making these!

They may not look pretty, but they taste pretty damn good!
I used the sfogliatelle recipe from here: https://crumbsoflove.wordpress.com/2013/11/27/sfogliatelle-an-italian-tail-three-ways/
I know you're supposed to use ricotta filling but I decided to do an eggnog cream filling. All it was was 1/2 cup sugar, 1/4 cup corn starch, 2 cups eggnog, pinch cinnamon and nutmeg and one egg. I added salt to taste and chopped up some chocolate(which melted).
This took me half a day and I broke my kitchen aid pasta machine attachment before I could finish my last sheet, so I had to roll it out by hand.
Overall I would make these again just with the ricotta filling and a fixed attachment!

WRITING.TITLE: Tried my hand at sfogliatelle...
